A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Last Jedi meets the quotas of a tolerable sci-fi movie but fails as a Star Wars film.

Rian Johnson never delivers on the foreshadowed plots left behind in The Force Awakens and discards it all together\, ruining the established lore and characters in the process.

The movie is Star Wars fanfiction\, almost as if the writer/director had a script for something else and decided to cram it into The Last Jedi.

Character development was regressive or nonexistent. Even Kylo Ren/Ben Solo is unchanged by the end of the movie\, shocking considering the amount of screentime that was afforded on him. Waste.

Movie is crammed with a lot of unneeded filler which should have been filled by something that was needed.

Characters are hardly believable as human beings\, something that was there in The Force Awakens.

Hollow story and jarring editing\, but great visuals and effects.
